text.sanskrit: जुषस्व नः समिधमग्ने अद्य शोचा बृहद्यजतं धूममृण्वन् ।उप स्पृश दिव्यं सानु स्तूपैः सं रश्मिभिस्ततनः सूर्यस्य ॥

translations.text: Be gratified,Agni, by the (sacred fire) kindled by us today, emitting abundant adorable smoke; touchwith your scorching flames the celestial summit; combine with the rays of the sun.

text.sanskrit: नराशंसस्य महिमानमेषामुप स्तोषाम यजतस्य यज्ञैः ।ये सुक्रतवः शुचयो धियंधाः स्वदंति देवा उभयानि हव्या ॥

translations.text: We celebrate with sacrifices the greatness of the adorable Narāśaṃsa among those who aredivinities, the performers of good works, the bright-shining, the upholders of rites, who partake of both kinds ofoblations.

translations.text: Let us ever worship theAgniwho is to be adored by us; the mighty, the dextrous, the messengerpassing between heaven and earth, the speaker of truth, kindled (of old) byManu, as now by men, that (he maycome) to the solemnity.

text.sanskrit: ईळेन्यो वो मनुषो युगेषु समनगा अशुचज्जातवेदाः ।सुसंदृशा भानुना यो विभाति प्रति गावः समिधानं बुधंत ॥

translations.text: You,Agni, are to be glorified in (all) the ages of men; you,Jātavedas, who are illustrious whenengaged in battle; our praises wake up the kindling (Agni), him who shines with conspicuous splendour.

text.sanskrit: अग्ने याहि दूत्यं मा रिषण्यो देवाँ अच्छा ब्रह्मकृता गणेन ।सरस्वतीं मरुतो अश्विनापो यक्षि देवान्रत्नधेयाय विश्वान् ॥

translations.text: Repair,Agni, to the presence of the gods in your office of messenger, (sent) by the assembly engagedin prayer; neglect us not; offer worship toSarasvati, theMaruts, theAśvins, the waters, the universal gods, thatthey may bestow treasures (upon us).
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

translations.text: Vasiṣṭhais kindling you,Agni; destroy the malignant; worship the object of many rites, (the company ofthe gods), on behalf of the wealthy (instrumental tutor of the sacrifice), praise (the gods),Jātavedas, with manifoldpraises, and do you ever cherish us with blessings.

translations.text: Offer the oblation to the presentAgni, the showerer (of benefits); pour into the mouth of him who(bears) to us the nearest relationship.

translations.text: Indra, has effected a valuable (donation) by a pauper; he has slain an old lion by a goat; he has cut theangles of the sacrificialpostwith a needle; he has given all the spoils (of the enemy) toSudāsa.

translations.text: Your numerous enemies,Indra, have been reduced to subjection, effect at some time or other thesubjugation of the turbulentBheda, who holds men praising you as guilty of wickedness; hurl, Indra, your sharpthuderbolt against him.

text.sanskrit: द्वे नप्तुर्देववतः शते गोर्द्वा रथा वधूमंता सुदासः ।अर्हन्नग्ने पैजवनस्य दानं होतेव सद्म पर्येमि रेभन् ॥

text.sanskrit: हंता वृत्रमिंद्रः शूशुवानः प्रावीन्नु वीरो जरितारमूती ।कर्ता सुदासे अह वा उ लोकं दाता वसु मुहुरा दाशुषे भूत् ॥
text.iast: hantā  vṛtram  índraḥ  śūśuvānaḥ  pra  āvīt  nu  vīraḥ  jaritāram  ūtī kartā  su-dāse  aha  vai  ūṃ íti  lokam  dātā  vasu  muhuḥ  ā  dāśuṣe  bhūt ||

translations.text: Indra, dilating in bulk, is the slayer ofVṛtra; the hero defends his worshipper promptly with hisprotection, whether he be the giver of dominion toSudāsa, or the donor repeatedly of wealth to the offerer (ofoblations).

text.sanskrit: युध्मो अनर्वा खजकृत्समद्वा शूरः सत्राषाड् जनुषेमषाळ्हः ।व्यास इंद्रः पृतनाः स्वोजा अधा विश्वं शत्रूयंतं जघान ॥
text.iast: yudhmaḥ  anarvā  khaja-kṛt  samat-vā  śūraḥ  satrāṣāṭ  januṣā  īm  aṣāḷhaḥ ví  āse  índraḥ  pṛtanāḥ  su-ojāḥ  adha  víśvam  śatru-yantam  jaghāna ||

translations.text: A warrior who turns not back in battle, a combatant, one engaged in tumults, a hero, victorious over(his) foes from birth, invincible, of great vigour, thisIndrascatters (hostile) hosts and slays all (his) adversaries.

translations.text: OpulentIndra, you have filled both heaven and earth with your magnitutde, your energies; Indra, thelord of horses, brandishing the thunderbolt, is gratified at sacrifices by the (sacrificial) food.

text.iast: vṛṣā  jajāna  vṛṣaṇam  raṇāya  tam  ūṃ íti  cit  nārī  naryam  sasūva pra  yaḥ  senā-nīḥ  adha  nṛ-bhyaḥ  asti  inaḥ  satvā  go-eṣaṇaḥ  saḥ  dhṛṣṇuḥ ||

translations.text: (His) progenitor begotIndra, the showerer (of benefits) for (the purpose of) war; his mother brought himforth the benefactor of man; the leader of armies who is chief over men, he is the lord, the conqueror, therecoverer of the kine, the subduer of foes.

text.sanskrit: नू चित्स भ्रेषते जनो न रेषन्मनो यो अस्य घोरमाविवासात् ।यज्ञैर्य इंद्रे दधते दुवांसि क्षयत्स राय ऋतपा ऋतेजाः ॥
text.iast: nu  cit  saḥ  bhreṣate  janaḥ  na  reṣat  manaḥ  yaḥ  asya  ghoram  ā-vívāsāt yajñaiḥ  yaḥ  índre  dadhate  duvāṃsi  kṣayat  saḥ  rāye  ṛta-pāḥ  ṛte-jāḥ ||

translations.text: He who devotes his mind to the terribleIndranever falls (from his condition), nor will he perish; theprotector of sacred rites, the progeny of sacrifice, bestows riches on him who offers to Indra praises and prayerswith sacrifices.

text.sanskrit: यदिंद्र पूर्वो अपराय शिक्षन्नयज्ज्यायान्कनीयसो देष्णं ।अमृत इत्पर्यासीत दूरमा चित्र चित्र्यं भरा रयिं नः ॥
text.iast: yat  indra  pūrvaḥ  aparāya  śíkṣan  ayat  jyāyān  kanīyasaḥ  deṣṇam amṛtaḥ  ít  pari  āsīta  dūram  ā  citra  cítryam  bhara  rayím  naḥ ||

translations.text: That (wealth)Indra, which the prior has given to the posterior; which the elder may accept from theyounger; with which (the son) yet living dwells far away (separated from his father), confer, wonderful Indra, suchprecious riches upon us.

text.iast: yaḥ  te  indra  priyaḥ  janaḥ  dadāśat  asat  nireke  adri-vaḥ  sakhā  te vayam  te  asyām  su-matau  caniṣṭhāḥ  syāma  varūthe  aghnataḥ  nṛ-pītau ||

translations.text: May the man who is dear to you,Indra, present (oblations); may he be your friend, wielder of thethunderbolt, he (assiduous) in donations; may we be abounding in food through this favour of you who aredevoid of cruelty, (may we be in the enjoyment of) a dwelling giving shelter to men.

text.iast: eṣaḥ  stomaḥ  acikradat  vṛṣā  te  uta  stāmuḥ  magha-van  akrapiṣṭa rāyaḥ  kāmaḥ  jaritāram  te  ā  agan  tvam  aṅga  śakra  vasvaḥ  ā  śakaḥ  naḥ ||

translations.text: For you,Maghavan, this showeringSoma(libation) cries aloud; to you the worshipper has recitedpraises; the desire of riches has fallen upon thine adorer, do you, therefore,Śakra, bestow quickly upon uswealth.

translations.text: The white-complexioned accomplishers of holy ceremonies, wearing the lock of hair on the right side,have afforded me delight, when, rising up I call the leaders (of rites) to the sacred grass; theVasiṣṭhas, (mysons) should never be far from me.

translations.text: Disgracing (Pāśadyumna), they brought from afar the fierceIndra, when drinking the ladle ofSomaathissacrifice, to (receive) the libation (ofSudāsa); Indra hastened from the effused Soma of Pāśadumna, theson of Vāyata, to theVasiṣṭhas.

text.sanskrit: एवेन्नु कं सिंधुमेभिस्ततारेवेन्नु कं भेदमेभिर्जघान ।एवेन्नु कं दाशराज्ञे सुदासं प्रावदिंद्रो ब्रह्मणा वो वसिष्ठाः ॥
text.iast: eva  ít  nu  kam  síndhum  ebhiḥ  tatāra  eva  ít  nu  kam  bhedam  ebhiḥ  jaghāna eva  ít  nu  kam  dāśa-rājñe  su-dāsam  pra  āvat  índraḥ  brahmaṇā  vaḥ  vasiṣṭhāḥ ||

translations.text: In the same manner was he, (Sudāsa) enabled by them easily to cross theSindhuriver; in the samemanner, through them he easily slew his foe; so in like manner,Vasiṣṭhas, through your prayers, did Indradefend Sudāsa in the war with the ten kings.

translations.text: By your prayers, leaders (of rites), is effected the gratificcation of your progenitors; I have set in motionthe axle (of the chariot); be no you intert, for by your sacred metres,Vasiṣṭhas, (chanted) with a loud voice, yousustain vigour inInda.

text.sanskrit: सूर्यस्येव वक्षथो ज्योतिरेषां समुद्रस्येव महिमा गभीरः ।वातस्येव प्रजवो नान्येन स्तोमो वसिष्ठा अन्वेतवे वः ॥

translations.text: The glory of theseVasi.ṣṭhas is like the splendour of the sun; their greatness as profound as (thedepth of) the ocean; your praise,Vasiṣṭhas, has the velocity of the wind; by no other can it be surpassed.

translations.text: May the divine preservingSavitābe (radiant for) our happiness; may the opening dawns (break for)our happiness; mayParjanyabe (the granter of happiness) to our posterity; mayŚambhu, the lord of strength,be (the conferrer of) happiness upon us.

text.sanskrit: अस्य देवस्य मीळ्हुषो वया विष्णोरेषस्य प्रभृथे हविर्भिः ।विदे हि रुद्रो रुद्रियं महित्वं यासिष्टं वर्तिरश्विनाविरावत् ॥

translations.text: For your preservation, (worshippers), I invoke, first, Dadhikrā, then theAśvins, the Dawn, the kindledAgni,Bhaga,Indra,Viṣṇu,Pūṣan,Brahmaṇaspati, theĀdityas, heaven and earth, the waters, the sun.

translations.text: Arousing and animating Dadhikrā, proceeding diligently with the sacrifice; seating the divine Iḷā onthe sacred grass, let us invoke the intelligent and worthily-invokedAśvins.

text.sanskrit: स्तेनं राय सारमेय तस्करं वा पुनःसर ।स्तोतॄनिंद्रस्य रायसि किमस्मांदुच्छुनायसे नि षु स्वप ॥

translations.text: Offspring ofSaramā, returning (to the charge), attack the pilferer or the thief; why do you assail theworshippers ofIndra? Why do you intimidate us? Go quietly to sleep.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

translations.text: Never,Maruts, may we be excluded from your bounty; let us not, lords of chariots, be last in itsapportionment; make us sharers in that desirable opulence which, showerers (of benefit), is born of you.

text.sanskrit: भूरि चक्र मरुतः पित्र्याण्युक्थानि या वः शस्यंते पुरा चित् ।मरुद्भिरुग्रः पृतनासु साळ्हा मरुद्भिरित्सनिता वाजमर्वा ॥

translations.text: You are vaster,MitraandVaruṇa, than the ample earth, vaster, bounteous donors, than the gloriousand expansive heaven; you maintain beauty in plural nts and in people, diligent observers of truth, and vigilantlyprotecting (us).

text.sanskrit: शंसा मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धाम शुष्मो रोदसी बद्बधे महित्वा ।अयन्मासा अयज्वनामवीराः प्र यज्ञमन्मा वृजनं तिराते ॥

translations.text: Praise the splendour ofMitraandVaruṇa, whose strength, by its might, keeps heaven and earthasunder; may the days of those who differ not worship pass withoutmaledescendants; amy he who delights insacrifice increase in prosperity.

text.sanskrit: अमूरा विश्वा वृषणाविमा वां न यासु चित्रं ददृशे न यक्षं ।द्रुहः सचंते अनृता जनानां न वां निण्यान्यचिते अभूवन् ॥

translations.text: Unperplexed, all-pervading showerers (of benefits), these (praises) are for you, in which nothingsurprising, no adoration (worthy of you) is beheld; the insincere commendations of men serve as offences;eulogies of you, althogh offered in secret, are not unappreciated.

translations.text: I offer sacrifice to you two with praises, I invoke you,MitraandVaruṇa, when in trouble; may thepresent hymns be capable of gratifying you; may these (my) prayers be acceptable to you both.

translations.text: Many are the days that have dawned before the rising of the sun, on which you, Uṣas, have beenbeheld like a wife going to an inconstant husband, and not like one deserting him.

text.sanskrit: समान ऊर्वे अधि संगतासः सं जानते न यतंते मिथस्ते ।ते देवानां न मिनंति व्रतान्यमर्धंतो वसुभिर्यादमानाः ॥

text.sanskrit: सं भूम्या अंता ध्वसिरा अदृक्षतेंद्रावरुणा दिवि घोष आरुहत् ।अस्थुर्जनानामुप मामरातयोऽर्वागवसा हवनश्रुता गतं ॥

translations.text: The ends of the earth are beheld laid waste; the clamour has ascended,IndraandVaruṇa, to heaven;the adversaries of my people approach me; having heard my invocation, come for my defence.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: इंद्रावरुणा वधनाभिरप्रति भेदं वन्वंता प्र सुदासमावतं ।ब्रह्माण्येषां शृणुतं हवीमनि सत्या तृत्सूनामभवत्पुरोहितिः ॥

translations.text: IndraandVaruṇa, you protectedSudāsa, overwhelming the yet unassailedBhedawith your fatalweapons; here the prayers of threse Tṛtsus in time of battle, so that my ministration may have borne them fruit.

text.sanskrit: इंद्रावरुणावभ्या तपंति माघान्यर्यो वनुषामरातयः ।युवं हि वस्व उभयस्य राजथोऽध स्मा नोऽवतं पार्ये दिवि ॥
text.iast: índrāvaruṇau  abhí  ā  tapanti  mā  aghāni  aryaḥ  vanuṣām  arātayaḥ yuvam  hí  vasvaḥ  ubhayasya  rājathaḥ  adha  sma  naḥ  avatam  pārye  diví ||

translations.text: IndraandVaruṇa, the murderous (weapons) of my enemy distressme; foes among the malignant(assail me); you two are sovereigns over both (celestial and terrestrial) wealth; protect us therefore, onthe day ofbattle.

text.sanskrit: युवां हवंत उभयास आजिष्विंद्रं च वस्वो वरुणं च सातये ।यत्र राजभिर्दशभिर्निबाधितं प्र सुदासमावतं तृत्सुभिः सह ॥
text.iast: yuvām  havante  ubhayāsaḥ  ājíṣu  índram  ca  vasvaḥ  varuṇam  ca  sātaye yatra  rāja-bhiḥ  daśa-bhiḥ  ní-bādhitam  pra  su-dāsam  āvatam  tṛtsu-bhiḥ  saha ||

translations.text: Both (Sudāsaand the Tṛtsus) call upon you two (IndraandVaruṇa), in combats for the acquisition ofwealth, when you defend Sudāsa, together with Tṛtsus, when attacked bythe tenrājās.

text.sanskrit: दश राजानः समिता अयज्यवः सुदासमिंद्रावरुणा न युयुधुः ।सत्या नृणामद्मसदामुपस्तुतिर्देवा एषामभवंदेवहूतिषु ॥
text.iast: daśa  rājānaḥ  sam-itāḥ  ayajyavaḥ  su-dāsam  indrāvaruṇā  na  yuyudhuḥ satyā  nṛṇām  adma-sadām  upa-stutiḥ  devāḥ  eṣām  abhavan  deva-hūtiṣu ||

translations.text: The ten confederated irreligiousrājāsdid not prevail,IndraandVaruṇa, againstSudāsa; the praiseof the leaders (of rites), the offerers of sacrificial food, was fruitful; the gods were present at their sacrifices.

text.sanskrit: वृत्राण्यन्यः समिथेषु जिघ्नते व्रतान्यन्यो अभि रक्षते सदा ।हवामहे वां वृषणा सुवृक्तिभिरस्मे इंद्रावरुणा शर्म यच्छतं ॥
text.iast: vṛtrāṇi  anyaḥ  sam-itheṣu  jíghnate  vratāni  anyaḥ  abhí  rakṣate  sadā havāmahe  vām  vṛṣaṇā  suvṛktí-bhiḥ  asme íti  indrāvaruṇā  śarma  yacchatam ||

translations.text: One of you destroys enemies inbattle, the other ever protects religious observances; we invoke you,showerers (of benefits), with praises; bestow upon us,IndraandVaruṇa, felicity.

text.sanskrit: अस्मे इंद्रो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा द्युम्नं यच्छंतु महि शर्म सप्रथः ।अवध्रं ज्योतिरदितेर्ऋतावृधो देवस्य श्लोकं सवितुर्मनामहे ॥
text.iast: asme íti  índraḥ  varuṇaḥ  mitraḥ  aryamā  dyumnam  yacchantu  mahi  śarma  sa-prathaḥ avadhram  jyotiḥ  aditeḥ  ṛta-vṛdhaḥ  devasya  ślokam  savituḥ  manāmahe ||

translations.text: MayIndra,Varuṇa,Mitra,Aryamangrant us wealth and a large and spacious mansion; may the lustreofAditi, the augmentress (of sacrifice), be innoxious to us; we recite the praise of the divineSavitā.

text.sanskrit: आ वां राजानावध्वरे ववृत्यां हव्येभिरिंद्रावरुणा नमोभिः ।प्र वां घृताची बाह्वोर्दधाना परि त्मना विषुरूपा जिगाति ॥
text.iast: ā  vām  rājānau  adhvare  vavṛtyām  havyebhiḥ  indrāvaruṇā  namaḥ-bhiḥ pra  vām  ghṛtācī  bāhvoḥ  dadhānā  pari  tmanā  víṣu-rūpā  jigāti ||

translations.text: RoyalIndraandVaruṇa, I invite you to the sacrifice with oblations and with praise; the butter-dropping(ladle), held in ourhands, offers spontaneously (the oblation) to you who are of many forms.

text.sanskrit: युवो राष्ट्रं बृहदिन्वति द्यौर्यौ सेतृभिररज्जुभिः सिनीथः ।परि नो हेळो वरुणस्य वृज्या उरुं न इंद्रः कृणवदु लोकं ॥
text.iast: yuvoḥ  rāṣṭram  bṛhat  invati  dyauḥ  yau  setṛ-bhiḥ  arajju-bhiḥ  sinīthaḥ pari  naḥ  heḷaḥ  varuṇasya  vṛjyāḥ  urum  naḥ  índraḥ  kṛṇavat  ūṃ íti  lokam ||

translations.text: Your vast kingdom of heaven gratifies (the world with rain), you who bind (the sinner) with bonds notmade of rope; may the wrath ofVaruṇapass away from us; mayIndraprepare for us a spacious region.

text.sanskrit: कृतं नो यज्ञं विदथेषु चारुं कृतं ब्रह्माणि सूरिषु प्रशस्ता ।उपो रयिर्देवजूतो न एतु प्र णः स्पार्हाभिरूतिभिस्तिरेतं ॥
text.iast: kṛtam  naḥ  yajñam  vidatheṣu  cārum  kṛtam  brahmāṇi  sūríṣu  pra-śastā upo íti  rayíḥ  deva-jūtaḥ  naḥ  etu  pra  naḥ  spārhābhiḥ  ūtí-bhiḥ  tiretam ||

translations.text: Render the sacrifices offered inour dwelling fruitful, the prayers uttered by the worshippers successful;may riches come to us sent by the gods; do you two give us increase by you desirable protections.

translations.text: Bestow upon us,IndraandVaruṇa, riches desirable to all, together with a dwelling and abundant food,for the hero,Āditya, who punishes beings devoid of truth, gives (to the devout) unbounded treasures.

text.sanskrit: इयमिंद्रं वरुणमष्ट मे गीः प्रावत्तोके तनये तूतुजाना ।सुरत्नासो देववीतिं गमेम यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः ॥

translations.text: May this my praise reachIndraandVaruṇa, and, earnestly offered (by me), preserve sons andgrandsons; let us, possessed of affluence, present (their) food to the gods; and do you, (duties), ever cherish uswith blessings.

text.sanskrit: उत स्वया तन्वा सं वदे तत्कदा न्वंतर्वरुणे भुवानि ।किं मे हव्यमहृणानो जुषेत कदा मृळीकं सुमना अभि ख्यं ॥

text.sanskrit: किमाग आस वरुण ज्येष्ठं यत्स्तोतारं जिघांससि सखायं ।प्र तन्मे वोचो दूळभ स्वधावोऽव त्वानेना नमसा तुर इयां ॥

translations.text: What has that great wickedness been,Varuṇa, that you should seek to destroy the worshiper, yourfriend? Insuperable, resplendent Varuṇa, declare it to me, so that, freed from sin, I may quick approach you withveneration.

text.sanskrit: अव द्रुग्धानि पित्र्या सृजा नोऽव या वयं चकृमा तनूभिः ।अव राजन्पशुतृपं न तायुं सृजा वत्सं न दाम्नो वसिष्ठं ॥

translations.text: Relax (the bonds) imosed by all the ill deeds of our fore-fathers, and those incurred (by the sins) whichwe have committed in our person ns; liberate, royalVaruṇa, like a calf from its tether,Vasiṣṭhalike a thiefnourishing the animal (he has stolen).

text.sanskrit: न स स्वो दक्षो वरुण ध्रुतिः सा सुरा मन्युर्विभीदको अचित्तिः ।अस्ति ज्यायान्कनीयस उपारे स्वप्नश्चनेदनृतस्य प्रयोता ॥

translations.text: It is not our own choice,Varuṇa, not our condition, (that is the cause of our sinning); it is that which isintoxication, wrath, gambling, ignorance; there is a senior in the proximity of the junior; even a dream is aprovocation to sin.

translations.text: Thine is all this animal world around you, which you illumine with the light of the sun; you,Indra, are theone lord of cattle, thence may we possess wealh bestowed by you.

text.sanskrit: ये पाकशंसं विहरंत एवैर्ये वा भद्रं दूषयंति स्वधाभिः ।अहये वा तान्प्रददातु सोम आ वा दधातु निर्ऋतेरुपस्थे ॥

translations.text: MaySomagive to the serpent, or toss upon the lap ofNirṛti, those who with designing (accusative ations)person cute me, a speaker of sincerely, and those who by spiteful (calumnies) vilify all that is good in me.

text.sanskrit: यो नो रसं दिप्सति पित्वो अग्ने यो अश्वानां यो गवां यस्तनूनां ।रिपुः स्तेनः स्तेयकृद्दभ्रमेतु नि ष हीयतां तन्वा तना च ॥
text.iast: yaḥ  naḥ  rasam  dípsati  pitvaḥ  agne  yaḥ  aśvānām  yaḥ  gavām  yaḥ  tanūnām ripuḥ  stenaḥ  steya-kṛt  dabhram  etu  ní  saḥ  hīyatām  tanvā  tanā  ca ||

translations.text: May he,Agni, who strives to destroy the essence of our food, of our horse, of our cattle, of our bodies--the adversary, the thief, the robber-- go to destruction, and be deprived both of person n and of progeny.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: परः सो अस्तु तन्वा तना च तिस्रः पृथिवीरधो अस्तु विश्वाः ।प्रति शुष्यतु यशो अस्य देवा यो नो दिवा दिप्सति यश्च नक्तं ॥
text.iast: paraḥ  saḥ  astu  tanvā  tanā  ca  tisraḥ  pṛthivīḥ  adhaḥ  astu  víśvāḥ prati  śuṣyatu  yaśaḥ  asya  devāḥ  yaḥ  naḥ  dívā  dípsati  yaḥ  ca  naktam ||

translations.text: May he be deprived of bodily (existence) and of posterity; may he be cast down below all the threeworlds; may his reputation, Gods, be blighted who seeks our destruction by day or by night.

text.sanskrit: सुविज्ञानं चिकितुषे जनाय सच्चासच्च वचसी पस्पृधाते ।तयोर्यत्सत्यं यतरदृजीयस्तदित्सोमोऽवति हंत्यासत् ॥
text.iast: su-vijñānam  cikituṣe  janāya  sat  ca  asat  ca  vacasī íti  paspṛdhāte íti tayoḥ  yat  satyam  yatarat  ṛjīyaḥ  tat  ít  somaḥ  avati  hanti  asat ||

translations.text: To the understanding man there is perfect discrimination, the words of truth and falsehood are mutuallyat variance; of these two,Somaverily cherishes that which is true and right; he destroys the false.

text.sanskrit: न वा उ सोमो वृजिनं हिनोति न क्षत्रियं मिथुया धारयंतं ।हंति रक्षो हंत्यासद्वदंतमुभाविंद्रस्य प्रसितौ शयाते ॥
text.iast: na  vai  ūṃ íti  somaḥ  vṛjinam  hinoti  na  kṣatríyam  mithuyā  dhārayantam hanti  rakṣaḥ  hanti  asat  vadantam  ubhau  índrasya  pra-sitau  śayāte íti ||

translations.text: Somainstrumental gates not the wicked; he instrumental gates not the strong man dealing in falsehood; he destroys therākṣasa, he destroys the speaker of untruth; and both remain in the bondage ofIndra.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: यदि वाहमनृतदेव आस मोघं वा देवाँ अप्यूहे अग्ने ।किमस्मभ्यं जातवेदो हृणीषे द्रोघवाचस्ते निर्ऋथं सचंतां ॥
text.iast: yadi  vā  aham  anṛta-devaḥ  āsa  mogham  vā  devān  api-ūhe  agne kím  asmabhyam  jāta-vedaḥ  hṛṇīṣe  drogha-vācaḥ  te  niḥ-ṛtham  sacantām ||

translations.text: If I am one following false gods, if I approach the gods in vain, thenAgni(punishes me). If (we be notsuch, then) why,Jātavedas, are you angry with us? Let the utterers of falsehood incur your chastisement.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: अद्या मुरीय यदि यातुधानो अस्मि यदि वायुस्ततप पूरुषस्य ।अधा स वीरैर्दशभिर्वि यूया यो मा मोघं यातुधानेत्याह ॥

translations.text: May I this day die if I am a spirit of ill, or if I have ever injured the life of any ma; may you be deprived(rākṣasa) of your ten sons, who have falsely called me by such an appellation.

text.sanskrit: यो मायातुं यातुधानेत्याह यो वा रक्षाः शुचिरस्मीत्याह ।इंद्रस्तं हंतु महता वधेन विश्वस्य जंतोरधमस्पदीष्ट ॥
text.iast: yaḥ  mā  ayātum  yātu-dhāna  íti  āha  yaḥ  vā  rakṣāḥ  śuciḥ  asmi  íti  āha índraḥ  tam  hantu  mahatā  vadhena  víśvasya  jantoḥ  adhamaḥ  padīṣṭa ||

translations.text: MayIndraslay with his mighty weapon him who calls me theYātudhāna, which I am not, therākṣasa, who says (of himself), I am pure; may he, the vilest of all beings, perish.

text.sanskrit: प्र या जिगाति खर्गलेव नक्तमप द्रुहा तन्वं गूहमाना ।वव्राँ अनंताँ अव सा पदीष्ट ग्रावाणो घ्नंतु रक्षस उपब्दैः ॥

text.sanskrit: वि तिष्ठध्वं मरुतो विक्ष्विच्छत गृभायत रक्षसः सं पिनष्टन ।वयो ये भूत्वी पतयंति नक्तभिर्ये वा रिपो दधिरे देवे अध्वरे ॥
text.iast: ví  tiṣṭhadhvam  marutaḥ  vikṣu  icchata  gṛbhāyata  rakṣasaḥ  sam  pinaṣṭana vayaḥ  ye  bhūtvī  patayanti  nakta-bhiḥ  ye  vā  rípaḥ  dadhire  deve  adhvare ||

translations.text: Stay,Maruts, among the people, desirous (of protecting them); seize therākṣasas, grind them intopieces; whether you fly about like birds at night, or whether they have offered obstruction to the sacred sacrifice.

text.sanskrit: प्र वर्तय दिवो अश्मानमिंद्र सोमशितं मघवन्त्सं शिशाधि ।प्राक्तादपाक्तादधरादुदक्तादभि जहि रक्षसः पर्वतेन ॥

text.sanskrit: इंद्र जहि पुमांसं यातुधानमुत स्त्रियं मायया शाशदानां ।विग्रीवासो मूरदेवा ऋदंतु मा ते दृशंत्सूर्यमुच्चरंतं ॥
text.iast: índra  jahí  pumāṃsam  yātu-dhānam  uta  stríyam  māyayā  śāśadānām ví-grīvāsaḥ  mūra-devāḥ  ṛdantu  mā  te  dṛśan  sūryam  ut-carantam ||

translations.text: Slay,Indra, theYātudhāna, whether in the form of a man, or of a woman doing mischief by herdeceptions; may those who sport in murder perish dissipated; let them not behold the rising sun.
